Workers' strike in S. Korea
articles.content:
Workers' strike in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) - The (South) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions called a press conference on Tuesday, at which it declared that over 70,000 unionists under it would go on successive strikes at 270 odd work-sites from May 22, according to Seoul-based radio no.1.
 The organization charged that the "government" and the management are still taking insincere attitude toward the negotiations over the urgent demands of workers.
